summary: This is an internal FBI Victim Services Division email from July 2, 2020, informing staff of the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in New Hampshire. It details the charges against her and provides guidance on handling potential outreach from victims of the original Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested by the FBI's New York Division in Manchester, NH, on charges related to the enticement, transportation, and sexual abuse of minors, as well as perjury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the original charges; his victims may be impacted by the news of Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: Author of the email, providing internal notification and guidance to victim services staff regarding Maxwell's arrest.

connections.description: Maxwell is arrested on charges related to Epstein's criminal sexual activity with minors, indicating an alleged conspiracy.

connections.person1: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
connections.description: The Program Manager directs staff to the lead Victim Specialist (VS) for questions regarding the case.
The indictment identifies victims in relation to the charges against Maxwell for enticement and transportation of minors.

events.title: Grand Jury Returns True Bill
events.description: A grand jury in New York City returns a true bill (indictment) against Ghislaine Maxwell on multiple charges.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The FBI's New York Division arrests Ghislaine Maxwell in Manchester, New Hampshire, early in the morning.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in Manchester, New Hampshire, on July 2, 2020.
The indictment against Maxwell, returned on June 29, 2020, includes charges of enticement of a minor, conspiracy, transportation of a minor for criminal sexual activity, and perjury.
The FBI email notes that victims from the original Jeffrey Epstein case may be emotionally impacted by the news and may reach out to victim services.
The document instructs FBI staff to only repeat information from official SDNY and FBI statements as the investigation is active.
The indictment identifies specific victims, but their names are redacted in this document.
